current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend title 23, United States Code, to permit the consolidation of metropolitan planning
			 organizations, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Environment and Public Works

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Limitation on new metropolitan planning organizations

text.#text: A metropolitan planning organization shall not be designated—
each metropolitan planning organization may—
retain the designation as a metropolitan planning organization; or
agree to be consolidated with the other metropolitan planning organizations;
the existing metropolitan planning organizations and the applicable Governors may—

beginning on January 1, 2022, and once every 10 years thereafter, revisit the agreement described
			 in clause (i)(I); and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a justification of the continued necessity of that agreement; and

each metropolitan planning organization shall cooperate with every other metropolitan planning
			 organization to—

develop a single transportation improvement plan and a single long-range plan to be used by each
			 metropolitan planning organization when developing individual plans of the
			 metropolitan planning organization; and

to be used in developing individual performance targets of
